summary: When the Census Bureau isn't doing a decennial census, it estimates population and numbers of housing units, using various sources, annually. State, local, and tribal governments use the estimates to allocate federal funds, among other purposes. Governments can challenge these annual population estimates if they disagree with them. In 2024, government entities submitted 12 challenges. The Bureau revised population estimates in response to seven of...
title: Population Estimates: Results of the Census Bureau's Challenge Program
